intro: Waltheria communis var. henningsii, commonly known as the Hennings' spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and are often covered in fine hairs.
